meanings.definition: To soften or break down by soaking in a liquid
meanings.sent1: She will macer the fruits in water to make a delicious jam.
meanings.sent2: The chef will macer the meat in marinade to enhance its flavor.
meanings.sent3: The fruits were left to macer in the juice, creating a tasty treat.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to macer the memories, making them more bittersweet.
meanings.sent5: The rain helped macer the soil, preparing it for planting.

meanings.sent1: The macer is skilled at preparing herbal extracts.
meanings.sent2: As a macer, he knows the exact process to extract flavors.
meanings.sent3: The young macer accidentally spilled the liquid while working.
meanings.sent4: She was a macer of scents, blending fragrances for perfumes.
meanings.sent5: The macer carefully measured each ingredient for the extraction.

meanings.definition: A machine used for macerating substances
meanings.sent1: The factory installed a new macer for processing raw materials.
meanings.sent2: The macer efficiently breaks down the ingredients for production.
meanings.sent3: The noisy macer hummed as it worked on the fibers.
meanings.sent4: The old macer clanked loudly, signaling it needed maintenance.
meanings.sent5: The industrial macer was a crucial part of the manufacturing process.
